intro: Oreodaphne mexicana var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed oreodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less commonly studied species within its family.
